titles: A new song of Moggie's jealousie: or Jockies vindication Moggy from Jockey she needs wou'd depart, though Jockey he lov'd his Moggy at heart; Jockey he wondred at Moggies strange huff, but Moggy was jealous, and that was enough. Tune of, You London lads be merry; or, Woo't thou be wilfull still my Joe.
publisher: Printed for J. Deacon, atthe [sic] Angel in Guiltspur-street,
notes: Place and date of publication suggested by Wing.
Verse: "There was an [sic] a bonny young lad ..."
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
keywords: Broadsides --  England --  London --  Early works to 1800.
